intro: Meibomia canescens var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and covered with fine, whitish pubescence. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
